nl.rocmondriaan.greenfoot.game

Class Physics

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • nl.rocmondriaan.greenfoot.game.Physics
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MenuPlayer, Player, SelectorPlayer

    public class Physics
extends greenfoot.Actor

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) boolean canMoveLeft(double speed)
      Checks if the player will be inside of a solid block in the next frame, takes a double to see the movement of the next frame
      (package private) boolean canMoveRight(double speed)
      Checks if the player will be inside of a solid block in the next frame, takes a double to see the movement of the next frame
      (package private) void entityOffset()
      Simple little method to keep the doubleX and doubleY updated of objects that get scrolled by the camera to make sure no bugs happen (like things not moving properly).
      double getDoubleX()
      Simple method to get the accurate X coordinate of the entity on the screen
      double getDoubleY()
      Simple method to get the accurate Y coordinate of the entity on the screen
      (package private) void jump(double height) 
      (package private) void moveLeft(double speed)
      Moves the player by speed pixels to the left, uses doubleX to maintain accuracy with subpixels
      (package private) void moveRight(double speed)
      Moves the player by speed pixels to the right, uses doubleX to maintain accuracy with subpixels
      (package private) boolean onGround()
      Check if in the next frame the player will hit the ground if we make them fall by the gravity + 1 pixel returns true or false
      (package private) boolean onLadder()
      Checks if the player is currently on a ladder or not
      (package private) void setDoubleX(double x)
      Simple method to set the double X coordinate, should only be used at the very start like the first frame that the entity is in the world to set this to getX() Should never be messed with apart from that
      (package private) void setDoubleY(double y)
      Simple method to set the double Y coordinate, should only be used at the very start like the first frame that the entity is in the world to set this to getY() Should never be messed with apart from that
      (package private) void setNewLocation(double x, double y)
      Replacement for setLocation for everything that extends physics.
      (package private) void setRelativeLocation(double x, double y)
      Method that changes the position of the object only slightly, instead of hardcoding the position it simply takes the current position in doubleX and doubleY and adds to it.
      (package private) void updateGravity()
      Checks if the player is gonna hit the ground, will bump its head or is on a ladder if so it will set your vertical movement to zero, if not it will update the gravity
      private boolean willBumpHead()
      Checks if in the next frame the player will hit his head against a solid block above him.

    • Method Detail

      • getDoubleX

        public double getDoubleX()
        Simple method to get the accurate X coordinate of the entity on the screen
        Returns:
        returns the X coordinate of the entity as a double (so like 5.21), more accurate than getX()

      • getDoubleY

        public double getDoubleY()
        Simple method to get the accurate Y coordinate of the entity on the screen
        Returns:
        returns the Y coordinate of the entity as a double (so like 5.21), more accurate than getY()

      • setDoubleX

        void setDoubleX(double x)
        Simple method to set the double X coordinate, should only be used at the very start like the first frame that the entity is in the world to set this to getX() Should never be messed with apart from that
        Parameters:
        x - expects a double for what to set doubleX to

      • setDoubleY

        void setDoubleY(double y)
        Simple method to set the double Y coordinate, should only be used at the very start like the first frame that the entity is in the world to set this to getY() Should never be messed with apart from that
        Parameters:
        y - expects a double for what to set doubleY to

      • setNewLocation

        void setNewLocation(double x,
                    double y)
        Replacement for setLocation for everything that extends physics. this method is a literal replacement the only thing different here is that it instantly updates doublex and doubley so you get no problems in the future
        Parameters:
        x - excepts a double X value to set the entity to
        y - expects a double Y value to set the entity to

      • setRelativeLocation

        void setRelativeLocation(double x,
                         double y)
        Method that changes the position of the object only slightly, instead of hardcoding the position it simply takes the current position in doubleX and doubleY and adds to it. so moving 3 up would be (0, -3) to change the X by 0 and the Y by -3
        Parameters:
        x - expects a double X value to move the object along the x-axis
        y - expects a double Y value to move the object along the y-axis

      • entityOffset

        void entityOffset()
        Simple little method to keep the doubleX and doubleY updated of objects that get scrolled by the camera to make sure no bugs happen (like things not moving properly). Should be used in the act method of every object that extends physics, has no arguments

      • jump

        void jump(double height)

      • updateGravity

        void updateGravity()
        Checks if the player is gonna hit the ground, will bump its head or is on a ladder if so it will set your vertical movement to zero, if not it will update the gravity

      • onLadder

        boolean onLadder()
        Checks if the player is currently on a ladder or not
        Returns:
        returns true or false based on if the player is on a ladder or not

      • onGround

        boolean onGround()
        Check if in the next frame the player will hit the ground if we make them fall by the gravity + 1 pixel returns true or false
        Returns:
        returns true or false based on if the player is hitting the ground (or just standing on it)

      • willBumpHead

        private boolean willBumpHead()
        Checks if in the next frame the player will hit his head against a solid block above him.
        Returns:

      • canMoveLeft

        boolean canMoveLeft(double speed)
        Checks if the player will be inside of a solid block in the next frame, takes a double to see the movement of the next frame
        Parameters:
        speed - how far it should check to the left of you to see if you get into a block or not.
        Returns:
        returns true or false based on if you can move to the left or not

      • canMoveRight

        boolean canMoveRight(double speed)
        Checks if the player will be inside of a solid block in the next frame, takes a double to see the movement of the next frame
        Parameters:
        speed - how far it should check to the right of you to see if you get into a block or not.
        Returns:
        returns true or false based on if you can move to the right or not

      • moveRight

        void moveRight(double speed)
        Moves the player by speed pixels to the right, uses doubleX to maintain accuracy with subpixels
        Parameters:
        speed - how far the player should move to the right

      • moveLeft

        void moveLeft(double speed)
        Moves the player by speed pixels to the left, uses doubleX to maintain accuracy with subpixels
        Parameters:
        speed - how far the player should move to the left
